text: Salome Bey (October 10, 1939 â€“ August 9, 2020)While The Canadian Encyclopedia gives her year of birth as 1939, other sources say she was born in 1933 or 1944. was an American-born Canadian singer-songwriter, composer, and actress. She was born in Newark, New Jersey. Bey recorded two albums with Horace Silver, and released live albums of her performances with the Montreal Jubilation Gospel Choir and at the Montreux Jazz Festival. In 2005, she was made an honorary Member of the Order of Canada. Bey was a member of the Canadian charity Artists Against Racism.
